response.answer_text: Ok let’s look at the biological markers and see if they tell us what has happened in the past. (1) Orange Trees have been driven south 350 miles in 120 years. (2) Greenland which had large stands of Aspen now has all trees extinct from freezing over the past 1020 years. (3) Our Crops are sprouting at about 50% of normal for this time due to cold. This is all time record cold. I think I settled if there is any evidence of global warming. NONE! I know all the talk of CO2. The meter sits on Mauna Loa. It is directly downwind of Hilo Hawaii. The city and suburban area has grown since 1950 from about 10,000 to nearly 200,000. That matches the CO2 curve so sink that one there is a finger on the scale. They cheated. All of the discussion of a 1C rise depends on proxy data. The problem is proxy data is not accurate like the biological markers I gave you. Thermographic records suffer much accuracy problems and adjustment which means they are fiction. Prior to about 1940 the US weather records accuracy is limited by the measuring devices to within 1C. Prior to 1900 it may even be 2C. Similarly the places we record temperature data are subject to errors. The Weather Service was almost exclusively established to support aviation. It measures at Airports. Airports have gotten bigger, Airplanes have gotten bigger. Industry has moved in. Simple that warms up the thermometers. There is no real warming! This is a heater on the thermometer. Glaciers and Ice levels are NOT retreating. At this time they are advancing significantly. Polar Ice in the north is at historic high levels now. Are oceans rising. Clearly the tide gages show a rise in many but not all places. The consistent factor on the tide gages is the withdrawal of freshwater from port cities or oil deposits in the area. This sinks land. Honestly there could be some rising but if it is, it has been slowing down from the time of the last glacial epoch. No man effect here. This is fairly typical of US NWS offices. You put a lot of buildings and jets around a NWS office and it is bound to see some warming. There is your whole story in two pictures. Glacial retreat, sea levels always rising faster than before, average temps increasing and the definite increase of carbon dioxide is proof that humanity is causing extra radiative forcing (global warming) which will cause the climate to change, however uncertain that is. To me, the proof was in the lab over a century ago when John Tyndall proved what a greenhouse gas is. And now, the greatest evidence is sea level rise because it is doing so at an exponential rate, not w linear rate! Look at the graphs at the following site. Draw a line from 1880 to about 1945. To be fair, end the line at the halfway point in the gaps (that go above or below normal). Now draw another line from that to the 1980’s to the end at 2013. Now, look at the recent graph and see that in just the last 5 years, the line is going upwards even more! If we draw the line from the 1940’s to now, we see that the dip below the line is more exaggerated towards the recent, meaning that the rate of increase is accelerating, whereas if we were still exiting Europe's little ice age, the increase would be slowing or just linear. Another piece of evidence, though probably not proof, is the “control Earth” hypothesis. 3 million years ago during the Pliocene, the sea level was between 5–40 meters higher than it is today, depending upon the various different astronomical situations. The Isthmus of Panama was already in place (so no one can say “the world was a totally different place” then). The sun wasn't much dimmer (like it was during the far longer ago geo times that skeptics do like to compare apples to oranges). Guess what, that Pliocene had about 400 parts per million CO2! Sea Level | NASA Global Climate Change

There really isn’t any. Climate Change is real because the climate changes, and has changed. There are multiple times through out the history of the planet where the climate has drastically shifted, and truthfully - we don’t even fully understand why it happened then either. We simply do not fully understand the effects or factors behind what governs the changes to the climate that occur. Nature is both extremely fragile while at the same time surprisingly robust. It is hard to say what influence humans do have because we barely understand our current climate as-is, let alone what each thing does to impact it. This ultimately is the problem with Climate Change… there is no concrete information which either conclusively proves or disproves Climate Change or that it is being caused by Humans… As such - this only leaves the extremes of either side of the discussion to bicker. Pro-climate change fear-mongering people into apocalyptic predictions which have consistently failed to come true, and anti-climate change which claim what is happening being good (greener, faster growing plants) while not looking at the bigger picture (they die faster too).
